Package pl.put.poznan.sorting.rest

Class SortingMadnessController

java.lang.Object
pl.put.poznan.sorting.rest.SortingMadnessController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/") public class SortingMadnessController extends Object
The SortingMadnessController class is a REST controller that handles requests for sorting operations. It allows users to send data and parameters via a GET request and receive sorted results in JSON format.

  • Method Details

    • get

      @GetMapping(produces="application/json") public String get(@RequestBody Map<String,Object> jsonMap)
      Handles GET requests for sorting data. Expects a JSON body with the following fields:
      • to-sort - an array of integers to be sorted
      • algorithms - an array of sorting algorithm names to use
      • iterations - the maximum number of iterations to perform
      • order - the sorting order, e.g., ascending or descending
      Example request body: 
       {
     "to-sort": [5, 3, 8, 6, 2],
     "algorithms": ["BubbleSort", "QuickSort"],
     "iterations": 100,
     "order": "ascending"
 }
      Parameters:
      jsonMap - a map containing the input parameters as JSON
      Returns:
      a JSON response containing the sorted array and elapsed time in nanoseconds or an error message if the input is invalid
